page.title: 11A FARMER'S LIFE.
page.content: The farmer has 80 fresian cows,one bull and one jersey cow on 150 acres of land.He uses his land for grazing, hay and silage making.He has a wife and two children. Two dogs help him round up the cows. He starts milking at 6.45 a.m. and a tanker collects the milk at 8.00 a.m. Then it is time for breakfast. During the summer months there is hay and silage making to do depending on the weather. In winter the cows are kept inside and the shed has to cleaned out twice a day. In the afternoon the cows are milked again. Some of the calves are kept so that when the cows grow too old to produce good milk they can be replaced . The farmer's wife has to help bring in the cows, scrub the milking unit, do the housework, shopping and any other jobs that need to be done. The children also help where needed.
